name: ITP025 - AGL Conduit and Boring Installation
template name: FH-ZU2-QU-ITP025 - AGL Conduit and Boring Installation - Rev 0

name: 1.0 - Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ Using the correct and complete set of drawings.
○ All drawings are the latest revision.
Record of conformity - Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Work area has been cleared and surveyed (marked on site). Limits of excavation clearly defined.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that uPVC conduits comply with AS 1477 or equivalent AS 2053. Shall be heavy duty, orange for electrical services and white for communication services.
○ Ensure that pipe diameter is correct as per the drawings.
Reference Documents - ZULU-BECA- 001-SPC-00004 cl. 3.4 AS 1477 AS 2053
Record of conformity - Aconex reference This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that conduit bedding material is non- plastic granitic sand complying with Table 3-1 and 3-2 under cl. 3.8.3.3 of the Works Specification.
Acceptance Criteria - Location of services to be found and marked on the ground within the works;
○ Contractor to obtain excavation permit from APAM prior to any demolition works.
○ Services located within the works area to be exposed/proven, recorded as survey data and also on a service plan which is to be attached to the Excavation Permit.
Record of conformity - Melbourne Airport Excavation Permit
Acceptance Criteria - Trenches for conduits shall be excavated to the width and depth required enabling construction of the conduits to the requirements specified on the drawings.
○ The level at the bottom of the trench shall not be above the required level at any point.
○ Any over excavation under pavements shall be restored using 5MPa lean mix concrete in conjunction with the embedment.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Only approved methods of excavation that has been approved by the Principal’s Representative shall be used.
○ Location, level and configuration of existing service crossing to be recorded in as built documentation prior to backfill (including CAD model file)
Reference Documents - WMS002 – Working Near Existing Services
Record of conformity - As-built survey report
Acceptance Criteria - All conduits shall be rigidly supported and positioned by concrete or plastic spacer blocks so that no displacement occurs during backfill.
○ Where conduit ends are not open to a pit, UPVC end caps shall be temporarily fitted to each end.
○ Number of conduits and duct route to be confirmed for conformity with design.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to backfilling each lot
Acceptance Criteria - Surveyor to pick up completed conduit runs before backfill
Frequency - Prior to backfilling each lot

○ The Contractor must provide the Principal’s Representative notice of the Contractor’s intention to backfill trenches within a Lot. This must include details of the date, time and location of the proposed work.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete encasement of conduits: Conduits to be encased in 5MPa lean mix concrete as per drawings.

○ Trenches in existing pavement: Surface shall be reinstated to match surrounding pavement. Unless noted otherwise, reinstate asphalt pavement surfaces to a minimum of 70mm (or to match existing depth (whichever is greater)).
○ Trenches in new pavement: Pavement shall be constructed as per the drawings and specification.
Reference Documents - Drawings ZULU-BECA- 001-SPC-00004 cl. 3.8.2.1, cl. 3.8.2.2
Record of conformity - Delivery docket This ITP signed

Conduits to be encased in compacted sand bedding. The material shall be non-plastic and comply with properties specified in Table 3-1 & 3-2 of the specification. Details of the proposed sand shall be submitted to the Principal’s Representative.
– Not less than 90% maximum dry density (test no. 5.1.1).
– Not less than 70% of density index (test E6.1).
○ Compaction testing carried out at a rate of not less than:
– Bedding: 1 test per 400m of conduit laid (min. 3x).
– Backfill: 1 test per 400m of conduit laid per 0.5m of backfill depth (min. 3x).
Reference Documents - ZULU-BECA- 001-SPC-00004 cl. 3.8.3.1 cl. 3.8.3.2 cl. 3.8.3.3, AS 1289 Test no. 5.1.1 Test no. E6.1
Record of conformity - Test report Aconex reference This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project Engineer / Principal’s Representative / Foreman
Acceptance Criteria - Pavement edge duct markers shall be installed at the edge of pavements immediately over the centreline of duct banks.
○ Warning tape shall be to AS 2648.1, and coloured orange for electrical/white for communications conduits.
Reference Documents - ZULU-BECA- 001-SPC-00004 cl. 3.11 cl. 3.12 AS 2648.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

○ Following installation, the conduit shall be checked by passing a mandrel (not less than 300mm long and having a diameter of not more than 6mm less than the diameter of the conduit) through each way, followed by a brush with stiff bristles to clean the conduit of any foreign materials.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Primary Trenching Checklist

Acceptance Criteria - Each duct way in each duct bank shall be fitted with a single unjointed length of draw cord of a length equal to the length of the duct plus 4m. The draw cord shall be nylon rope and be 6mm in diameter, blue in colour. The ends of the rope shall be coiled at the bottom of each pit or wound around a stake.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Primary/Secondary Trenching Checklist
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
